<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="channel=burkeblack&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&videoId=v3641147&device_id=c46cabd768642fb8"></object><br/>As <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/burkeblack/profile"><strong>BURKEBLACK</strong></a> launches a rocket, he turns it into party time. He turns the music up and rocks out a bit. He celebrates what is to be a successful launch…until it’s suddenly not.</p>

omg that face

was this his first time at ksp?

PFAAAAAHAHAHAHA LMAO XDDD Just watch to the end!

(caps sorry)

All i could think of by the end of the video was blue, green, blue, green.

Man that face and that voice, it just made my day
AHAHAHAHAHHA!!!!!! His face as that SRB drifted away, and then the "Oh crap, its tumbling!" face later.

omg that face

was this his first time at ksp?

It had to have been his first time (or close to it). No experienced player would use THAT many boosters (terminal velocity), nor would they block their exhaust like that making them pointless. But, we've all done it at one point I'm sure, just part of learning the game

Edited January 9, 2015 by Alshain

Blue. Green. Blue. Green. Blue.

EDIT: Dammit. Kookoo beat me to it.

THAT ENDING though!!!

Not going to ruin it for anyone, but god, that was perfect!
